about-text:
We focus on exploring the connection between brain structure, function and human behavior, using magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).

We investigate what underlies behavioral and functional differences between individuals, such as changes in functional and structural connectivity and differences in the brain’s microstructure.

In addition, we study learning-related brain plasticity by developing behavioral tasks that induce functional and structural brain modifications. For our work, we use advanced mathematical and statistical analysis methods.

New paper published in Human Brain Mappi.content:
Check out our latest paper on short-term plasticity following motor sequence learning.

We used diffusion MRI to detect rapid microstructural changes in the brains of musically-naïve participants after a 45-minutes piano training. We found changes in diffusion properties in motor system regions such as the premotor cortex and cerebellum, providing an important reminder for the dynamic nature of the human brain and for the potential of diffusion MRI to follow on tissue plasticity over short timescales.
